description: From Middle English truely, treuly, treuli, trewely, treoweliche, treowliche, from Old English trēowlīċe (“faithfully; truly”), equivalent to true +‎ -ly. Cognate with Dutch trouwelijk, Middle Low German truwlike, German treulich, Swedish trolig, Icelandic trygglega.

adverbs.description: truly (comparative trulier or more truly, superlative truliest or most truly)

entries.meaning: (manner) In accordance with the facts; truthfully, accurately.

examples: That is truly all I know.
Truly, that is all I know.
